claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A table titled “Antigen manufacturing platforms” listing four vaccine platforms: Egg-based vaccines (hatch and grow in eggs; 30% of flu viruses don’t grow; mutations accumulate), Cell-based vaccines (grow in mammalian cells; some mutations), Recombinant protein–based vaccines (no virus needed; large-scale and quick), and mRNA/replicon platforms (no virus; self-amplifying RNA). Evidence: Under egg-based: “Mutations accumulate”; under cell-based: “Some mutations” The table shows that egg- and cell-based platforms can accumulate mutations during production but does not demonstrate that these mutations reduce vaccine effectiveness, so it does not support the claim Note: Image text is clear with no apparent quality issues
